meanings.definition: To strike or hit with the hand or a weapon.
meanings.sent1: He was couping the ball with his foot during the game.
meanings.sent2: She couped the door shut to keep it from swinging open.
meanings.sent3: The chef was couping the dough to make it into a perfect shape.
meanings.sent4: The waves couped against the rocks, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter was couping the nails into the wood to secure the structure.

meanings.sent1: The students were couping their ideas to create a group project.
meanings.sent2: She couped the puzzle pieces together to reveal the picture.
meanings.sent3: The magnets were couping together in an interesting pattern on the fridge.
meanings.sent4: The vines couped around the tree, forming a natural archway.
meanings.sent5: The workers were couping the pipes to ensure a proper connection.

meanings.definition: To take control or possession of something by force.
meanings.sent1: The invaders were couping the castle, claiming it as their own.
meanings.sent2: She couped the remote control to change the channel.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was couping the bird feeder, much to the birds' dismay.
meanings.sent4: The dictator couped the government, seizing power for himself.
meanings.sent5: The thief was couping the jewels from the display, planning a quick getaway.
